H0.text: Water is what grasses, shrubs, and trees make, which is why they are called producers.

H1.text: Carbon dioxide is what grasses, shrubs, and trees make, which is why they are called producers.

H2.text: Minerals are what grasses, shrubs, and trees make, which is why they are called producers.

H3.text: Food is what grasses, shrubs, and trees produce, so they are called producers.

A4.text: The sugars produced during carbon metabolism yield carbon skeletons that can be used for other metabolic reactions like the production of amino acids and lipids.
